quest.name: Way Down in the Hole
journal: Zuzumeda wishes to share with you a most amazing rumor.
Rumor has it that Wystan, a merchant living in Stonesthrow, is recruiting able-bodied adventurers to protect his team of prospectors. Speak to him at the Coffer & Coffin and volunteer your services.

While Wystan does not require additional escorts for the expedition, he would appreciate your assistance in convincing a group of children from Stonesthrow to stop waiting for him and return home. Offer Wystan's cookies to the children and persuade them to leave.
Your kind words and crumbling cookies are enough to satisfy the children. Let Wystan know that the situation has been resolved.

Even as Wystan is telling you about his ambitious plans for the future, one of the Brass Blades from the expedition party bursts into the bar and declares that they have made a promising discovery. Wasting no time, Wystan resolves to go and see for himself, and invites you to join him at the site.

Your confrontation with the Brass Blades is interrupted by a mysterious masked mage, who unleashes a clay golem upon you. In the chaotic battle that ensues, you somehow slay the rampaging construct moments before Thancred arrives.

Thancred's presence triggers more strange visions which you are unable to explain. Though your soul cries out for answers, this is neither the time nor place. Speak with Wystan, who has returned to the Coffer & Coffin.

Wystan now understands that he has been marked for death by Lord Lolorito. The ore vein, the Brass Blades, and the golem all appear to have been part of the trap. The merchant promises to do his utmost to hide your involvement, but he also suggests you seek the counsel of Mistress Momodi at the Quicksand, in case Lolorito's spies are already aware of your actions.

Momodi confirms that Wystan is finished in Ul'dah, but assures you that no one knows of your deeds. Though many would question the wisdom of opposing such powerful forces, she clearly approves of your actions. As a reward, Momodi grants you complimentary accommodation at the Hourglass, and permission to undertake guildleves.
objectives: Give ginger cookies to the children.
Follow Wystan to the Sil'dih ruins.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To accept this quest, you must abandon the current main scenario quest. Open the corresponding entry in the journal or duty list and select “Abandon.”

dialogue.name: ZUZUMEDA
dialogue.text: Ah, the altruistic adventurer! I was hoping we'd bump into each other. Why? Because the most fascinating piece of news recently reached my ears, and I'm eager to share it! May I?

dialogue.name: ZUZUMEDA
dialogue.text: Rumor has it that there is a vast, untapped vein of ore beneath the ruins of Sil'dih.

dialogue.name: ZUZUMEDA
dialogue.text: But that is not all! Inconceivably, the Concern appears to be entirely ignorant of its existence. And even as we speak, a young upstart─a self-made merchant from Stonesthrow of all places─is moving to claim it!

dialogue.name: ZUZUMEDA
dialogue.text: The fellow's name is Wystan, and he is a very, very ambitious young man. Not only does he intend to secure exclusive excavation rights, but they say his master plan is to use his new fortune to curry favor with the Sacrarium.

dialogue.name: ZUZUMEDA
dialogue.text: Of course, the thaumaturges only consider the opinions of the most wealthy when drafting the laws of Ul'dah. If you would have your voice heard, you must be prepared to pay a sultan's ransom.

dialogue.name: ZUZUMEDA
dialogue.text: One voice which is invariably heard belongs to Lord Lolorito. He has long lavished gil upon the thaumaturges, and some claim that he devises new laws with the express intention of ruining his competitors while protecting his own interests.

dialogue.name: ZUZUMEDA
dialogue.text: Suffice it to say, if Wystan thinks he can compete with the likes of the Syndicate, he's in for a rude awakening. But that eventuality may yet be a little way off. For the present, he is moving ahead with his plans, and assembling a team to survey the site.

dialogue.name: ZUZUMEDA
dialogue.text: I'm told he's at the Coffer & Coffin right now, recruiting able-bodied adventurers to escort his prospectors.

dialogue.name: ZUZUMEDA
dialogue.text: Warin said you were looking for work. Mayhap you should meet Wystan and volunteer for his expedition?

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: Come to join? Sorry, but you're too late.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: Some Brass Blades looking for extra coin volunteered, and the team's already en route to the ruins.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: But look, I know it's not easy to find work these days. If you're interested, there's something else you can do for me.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: There are these children outside─little ones from Stonesthrow. I look after them when I've time to spare, and so they've taken to following me around, even when I tell them not to.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: But what with overseeing the search for the vein, I barely have a chance to visit the privy at the moment, much less entertain younglings. Can you give them these ginger cookies and convince them to go home for me?

dialogue.name: KODOMOA
dialogue.text: I ain't goin' nowhere, missusmister! I'm too hungry to move, besides, so you'll have to carry me!

dialogue.name: KODOMOA
dialogue.text: A cookie!? ...Well, if Wystan really wants me to go home, then all right. But I want two next time!

dialogue.name: KODOMOB
dialogue.text: I like playing with Wystan. He makes sure no one bullies us.

dialogue.name: KODOMOB
dialogue.text: Wystan's worried about us? Oh, I don't want to make him worried. I'm a good girl, so I'll go home.

dialogue.name: KODOMOC
dialogue.text: But Wystan always plays with us! Why won't he come out and play?

dialogue.name: KODOMOC
dialogue.text: Wow, a ginger cookie! I'd better save some for my brother. I know─I'll go home and eat it with him!

dialogue.name: KODOMOD
dialogue.text: Wystan's kind to us. I like him.

dialogue.name: KODOMOD
dialogue.text: This is for me? I want to eat it, but then again I don't, because then it'd be gone.

dialogue.name: KODOMOD
dialogue.text: Tell Wystan thanks, and...tell him I'm sorry for getting in the way.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: Give the children those cookies and convince them to go home without me. I'll see that you're rewarded for your trouble.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: Thank you, adventurer. I only wish I could do more. Stonesthrow is no place for a child.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: ...Not that my childhood was much happier. Never enough food to go around, nor work to earn it─but no shortage of contempt from the great and the good.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: I remember thinking things could only get better... Yet now, after the Calamity and everything else...for us refugees to be forced to live outside the gates like bloody beastmen is a disgrace.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: They say with enough money you can change the laws here. So I'm going to make a fortune and do just that!

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: I'll buy the excavation rights and start my own mining business. Then I'll give my fellow refugees the work they're crying out for, and pay them fairly!

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: The mining companies have profited from our suffering for too long. But in their hubris they've grown complacent─presenting us with a golden opportunity.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: And we will take it, adventurer─we will reclaim our dignity, and with it our place within those walls.

dialogue.name: BRASSSENTRY
dialogue.text: We found her! We found the vein! Wystan, ye must come an' see!

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: Already!? Amazing! We leave at once!

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: You should join me, my friend! Come and bear witness to history in the making!

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“The Pursued and the Pursuing”?

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: INSTANCE
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: BRASSSENTRY
dialogue.text: Thal's balls, son! A vein of ore in the middle of a ruined bloody city? Godsdamned idiot!

dialogue.name: BRASSSENTRY
dialogue.text: What did ye think was gonna happen? That ye'd strike it rich and get cozy with the Order, while the masters of Ul'dah looked on? No one crosses the Syndicate!

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> The...the Syndicate!?

dialogue.name: BRASSSENTRY
dialogue.text: Hah! Finally sunk in, has it?

dialogue.name: BRASSSENTRY
dialogue.text: Well look at this! Not all yer friends've deserted ye, it seems... Lucky boy! Now ye won't have to die alone!

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)O mournful voice of creation! Grant ye this humble stone a soul, that it may wake to life!

dialogue.name: BRASSSENTRY
dialogue.text: Who's that spoutin' gibberish!? Show yerself!

dialogue.name: BRASSSENTRY
dialogue.text: This ain't part o' the plan! Bloody hells, does Lord Lolorito mean to kill us too!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the clay golem!

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text:
You are strong.
But are you strong enough to withstand this?

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: Yesss...writhe! Writhe in eternal Darkness!

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: Impossible! Never has the golem been so sorely tested!

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)That the golem could be vanquished...

dialogue.name: MASKEDMAGUS
dialogue.text: (-???-)That womanman is no ordinary adventurer.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Damn, seems I've missed all the fun.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I see you didn't need my help this time.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I would compose a ballad in your honor, but I fear no words would do you justice. The Songstress of Ul'dah herself could not rival your beauty.

dialogue.name: ACTIVEGIRL
dialogue.text: Oh, stop it!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I have oft heard it said that a blossom's beauty can move a man to love and long, but I never truly believed it until I met you two desert roses.

dialogue.name: BURNTMERCHANT
dialogue.text: I hear they attacked another caravan...

dialogue.name: MERCHANT2
dialogue.text: Aye, an' business is sufferin' for it. Bloody Amalj'aa... What's stirred 'em up, do you reckon?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Another raid...and I'll wager that caravan was carrying crystals, much like the last.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: If they truly mean to summon a primal, we must act quickly.

dialogue.name: ACTIVEGIRL
dialogue.text: Are you coming, love?

dialogue.name: AGGRESSIVEGIRL
dialogue.text: You wouldn't keep a girl waiting, would you!?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Perish the thought!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: So tell me, where in this marvel of a city might you lovely ladies be staying?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: At this rate, grain will soon be more precious than gold.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: A result of the uncommonly bad harvests, to be sure...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: And we have you to thank for them, do we not?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Aye, this weakening of the aetheric flow must surely be linked to Dalamud's descent.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: And, of course, to the primals.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: A fine mess. But we must not lose hope.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Louisoix will know what to do. We need only trust in his judgment.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Truly a marvel of Sharlayan ingenuity... It's as if I could reach out and touch the aether.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Time to focus... No more gallivanting about like before. The Scions are counting on you.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Have faith. Just have faith. You can do this.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Hmmm... This disturbance is recent.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The Sultantree? Maybe Papashan will know something of it.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Looks like they gave you quite a thrashing. Can you walk?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: It's me. I was too late. Our person of interest had already quit the scene. The General? Very well. I shall be there anon.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: My colleagues went to great lengths to provide me with the means to detect aetheric disturbances, but every time I find one, you seem to be in the middle of it. I'm starting to wonder if it might not be simpler just to follow you around. Sadly, I have business elsewhere.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Tread softly, my friend. The carefully laid trap you dismantled was clearly sanctioned by Lord Lolorito. I heard the Blades mention him as they fled. Believe me when I tell you that he is not a man to be trifled with.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The sultana's enemies grow bolder by the day, and I suspect they have the support of outside forces.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: Thank you. If you hadn't come along, those bastards would surely have slaughtered us all.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: I would speak with you further, but it isn't safe for us to linger here.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: Find me at the Coffer & Coffin later. Until then, stay safe.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I shall accompany Wystan and his men. They need protection─and I need more information.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ah, but where are my manners? I have yet to properly introduce myself. I am Thancred, a humble scholar surveying the flow of aether in Thanalan.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: It is an honor and a privilege to make your acquaintance. I hope when next we meet it is under more auspicious circumstances. Farewell!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...Ah. Wait a moment. It occurs to me that we may have...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Never mind. Fare thee well!

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: Twelve bless you, my friend. You risked your life to save ours.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: Betrayed by my own guards... Gods, I was a fool to trust those men.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: Lolorito owns the godsdamned Brass Blades. I should've questioned their motives from the start.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: Even so, I could hardly have predicted that the wealthiest man in Ul'dah would want me dead for the heinous crime of seeking to change the law! I'm just a merchant, for gods' sakes!

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: That ruthless bastard! And what of that monstrosity? Those were his own men! It beggars belief!

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: Well, that's it. I'm finished. If I stay in Ul'dah any longer, I'm as good as dead.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: My associates, my friends─gods, even the children may not be safe if I don't disappear. And you...godsdammit, if Lolorito learns of your involvement, you'll be next.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: I'll speak with the others and make sure your part in this stays secret. Beyond that, I don't know what to suggest... Maybe you should seek the counsel of Mistress Momodi.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: She's helped countless adventurers in her time. Mayhap she'll know what to do.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: Go quickly now, my friend. Lolorito's spies may be watching.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Settle down, Forename. You've got nothin' to worry about. No one seems to know you were at the ruins.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Wystan, on the other hand, is now a pariah─about as welcome 'round here as a rabid wolf, poor bugger. Suffice to say, that boy risked the wrath of the wrong man.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Lord Lolorito: chairman of the East Aldenard Trading Company, generous contributor to the Order of Nald'thal, and member of the Syndicate.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Didn't get where he is by leavin' loose ends, that one.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Which is why he ain't above killin' his own men.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Hells, even if those Blades knew what was comin', it's not like they could refuse to do their benefactor's biddin'.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: <sigh> Don't let this color your view of Ul'dah, Forename... It's true that there are some here who ain't afraid to crack a few skulls if it gets 'em what they want. But most of us are decent folk just tryin' to make ends meet.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: You know, a lot of people would call you a damn fool for riskin' your life to save a marked man...

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: But I believe you did a good thing, Forename, and for that you have my respect.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Listen: you've been through a lot lately. Why don't you rest a spell?

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: I'll have the boys at the Hourglass set you up with a room, my treat. Just have a word with Otopa Pottopa whenever you feel like stayin'.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: And when you've got your appetite for adventurin' back, consider takin' on a guildleve or two.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: We've a lot of requests from locals lookin' to hire adventurers for various jobs. It'd be a good way for you to earn yourself some extra gil.

dialogue.name: MOMODI
dialogue.text: Eustace can tell you more about how the system works, so go and speak with him if you're interested.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In recognition of your achievements, you have been granted access to guildleves and inn rooms.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: As you complete quests and embark on new adventures, the world will draw you ever deeper into its mysteries.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The great realm of Eorzea yet holds myriad roads untraveled and sights unseen. Continue along the path of the adventurer and discover what wonders await you!

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: If I don't disappear, everyone I know will be in danger─and that includes you, my friend.

dialogue.name: WYSTAN
dialogue.text: I pray you do not come to harm because of me.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You now have access to Recommendations. This feature displays a list of quests or duties currently available in your area.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Recommendations list can be opened from under Duty in the main menu, and will also be displayed automatically when you log in. If you find yourself unsure of what to do next, this tool makes it simple to locate activities suitable for your present class and level.
